p: Seventy eight actinomycetes with representative phenotypes were recovered from the Laohu Ditch, and the 16S rDNA sequencing revealed that the predominant genus was Streptomyces (73 isolates), followed by Nocardia (4 isolates), and one isolate with only 92% sequence similarity to its nearest match Micromonospora saelicesensis from the GenBank database, indicating that it may be a potential novel isolate at genus level. The phylogenetic tree demonstrating the relationship between the genera Streptomyces spp. (randomly selected representative sequences of Streptomyces spp.), Nocardia spp., and Micromonospora spp. was presented on Figure 1.
